Body: Please try restarting the game. If the problem persists, please contact our support team
Please try restarting the game. If the problem persists, please contact our support team
We couldn't solve it. It might be solved by restarting the game 'Restart'
Please charge your device
Please make sure your device is on, within range, and is not blocked

Header: Are you sure you want to quit?
Body: All data collected during this calibration will be erased, and you will be returned to the Home screen

Header: The system detected a high blinking frequency
Body: This can hurt the quality of the calibration. Try to keep your face relaxed during calibration

Header: The system did not detect you blinking at all
Body:
This may be caused by not setting up the cap, or specifically the Fz sensor properly. 
Visit the setup screen to fix this issue or continue anyways.
Close your eyes and relax

One of your sensors is displaying a noisy signal: {0}
Return to the set-up screen and fix this before continuing. 
Tips:
1. Make sure all graphs are showing normal behavior
2. Stay as still as possible when calibrating

Fix and recalibrate
Suggested fix:
1. Fix the Ref sensor first - adding a bit more gel, then shift it gently back and forth
2. If you used too much gel: Take off the cap, clean your head of gel and then put the cap back on
Try to relax your jaw and face muscles

Header: One of your sensors has disconnected: {0}
Body: Please return to the set-up screen to make sure it is connected properly

Header: The Bluetooth on your computer is disabled

Body: Check that it's on, then try to refresh the device list
Make sure your device is on and near the computer
An error occurred while trying to get a list of devices. Please try restarting the game
Try restarting your device and make sure it is near your computer
An error occurred while trying to establish a connection with the device. Please try restarting the game
Sorry, we couldn't connect to the device. Make sure your device is on and within range and try again
Try to turn your device off and on again, then try to connect
This is test emulator device which sends error always
An error occurred while trying to connect to the device. Please try again. If the problem persists, please contact our support team
An error occurred while trying to process your request. Please try restarting the game
The disconnection process is taking longer than expected. You can choose to continue waiting for the disconnection to complete or restart the game

Header: Are you sure, you want to quit the game?

Body: An error occurred while trying to process your request. Please try restarting the game
It seems like you tried launching the game using the wrong icon. If you need help, please contact us

Header: Are you sure, you want to quit the game?

Body: Check that internet is on and try again. If the problem persists, please contact our support team

Header: Are you sure you want to quit the session?
Body: You will not be able to continue the current session

Header: Interference detected in the EEG signal
Body: Check electrodes {0} in 'Setup' to fix. Resume training
Press 'Setup' to fix and continue training

Fix and recalibrate
Suggested fix:
1. Fix the Ref sensor first - adding a bit more gel, then shift it gently back and forth
2. If you used too much gel: Take off the cap, clean your head of gel and then put the cap back on. Use a dry towel to remove the gel

Header: The system noticed ongoing activation of facial muscles
Body: Try to relax your facial muscles

Header: In the last minute, the system didn't detect any blinking
Body: This may be due to improper setup of the cap, particularly the Fz sensor. Visit the setup screen to address this or continue regardless.

Header: The system noted a high blinking frequency
Body: Aim to maintain a relaxed facial expression during your training

Header: Some of your sensors are displaying a noisy signal
Body:
Return to the set-up screen and fix this before continuing 
Tips:
1. Make sure all graphs are showing normal behavior
2. Stay as still as possible when calibrating"

Fix and recalibrate
Suggested fix:
1. Fix the Ref sensor first - adding a bit more gel, then shift it gently back and forth
2. If you used too much gel: Take off the cap, clean your head of gel and then put the cap back on. Use a dry towel to remove the gel
Try to relax your jaws and face muscles

Header: The system did not detect any blinks during calibration
Body: This may be caused by not setting up the cap, or specifically the Fz sensor properly. It is recommended to check that the Fz is set up properly or to record calibration again

Header: The system detected a high blinking frequency
Body: This can hurt the quality of the calibration. Consider recalibrating. While calibrating - relax your face
The system detected blinks during eye closed state. We encourage you to keep your eyes closed at this stage
Your calibration was recorded at {0}, are you sure you want to skip calibration?

Header: Are you sure you want to discard your changes
Body: This will delete all the changes that you have just made to your playlist

Header: It appears that your playlist is empty.
Body: Please try adding a drill to your playlist and then save again

Header: A playlist with that name already exists
Body: Try changing your playlist's name and then save again
Are you sure you want to delete this playlist? This action cannot be undone
